column4: hi all, a quick question - i'm thinking about installing php on my laptop (ubuntu), and the recommended ubuntu/debian way is through apt-get - but they only seem to have packages labeled "php5" - as i have no idea which version of php this actually is, and i want to install a specific version (ie. 5.3.14), my only choice is to install php from source, right?
There's no promise you *CAN* find a PPA that packages your desired version, though.
yeah, i'm beginning to see that. nevermind, i guess i could use some experience with installing php on my own
